meanings.definition: Showing the most spirit or readiness to fight or argue.
meanings.sent1: She was the sparriest student in the debate club, always eager to argue her point.
meanings.sent2: The team captain selected the sparriest player to lead the group in the final match.
meanings.sent3: During the class discussion, John was the sparriest, challenging every statement with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: Her sparriest attitude in the courtroom made her a formidable opponent for any lawyer.
meanings.sent5: The sparriest kitten in the litter fearlessly stood up to the bigger cats.

meanings.sent1: The sparriest boxer in the gym trained diligently every day to improve his skills.
meanings.sent2: Among all the martial artists, he was considered the sparriest due to his quick reflexes.
meanings.sent3: The sparriest dog in the park loved play-fighting with other dogs, always showing his playful side.
meanings.sent4: Her sparriest nature in negotiations helped her secure the best deals for her clients.
meanings.sent5: The sparriest wrestler in the league was known for his strategic moves and agility.
